title: chat commands not working
body: Have an issue where none of the built in commands like spawn, kick, ban, users work at all. it only says the command isnt found even though the command file has them in it. any fix?
author: JBork1

comments.body: Enable plugins in the server config
Ah, thank you. was having an issue banning someone earlier but now i can deal with them.

title: "spawn" command error handling
body:
Hi, I run my own cove server and when messing around with commands, I typed "spawn" without any arguments. This caused the server to crash. I thought this could definitely cause issues with other people, especially when they rely on the server to be reliable, so I fixed it!

My fix involves adding a simple if statement that checks if the args array has at least one parameter. If there's at least one parameter, it goes on like usual. Otherwise, it says the issue to the user and returns the code. This prevents someone from adding no args and the server checking for args[0].

I really hope this is helpful, as I love this piece of software.

Thanks,
Monika
author: Monikaya

comments.body: Thank you so much! I had heard about the spawn command crashing a server before, but was never able to get a crash log!!!!!! Your awesome

title: Add more illegal actors and format actor detection
body:
Adds more illegal actors that players can not spawn:
**Canvas** - unused actor ingame used for abuse
**Ambient Bird** - supposed to be spawned by server only
**Void Portal, Metal Spawn** - should only be spawned by server only

I also improved the code to be formatted better.

comments.body: ðŸ˜„
lmao, thank you

title: Names in mails show up as "null"
body: Had some users report that names in mail show up as "null". I'm only fairly sure that that's something to do with this server software, so i'm reporting it here.
author: ShadowJonathan

comments.body: i'm pretty sure this happened to me before i was using Cove ðŸ¤” when a player's name is "" (blank), but oh well
This is an issue outside of Cove as far as I am aware.
Mail is sent directly from player to player without being sent though the server, this is just a webfishing issue.

title: Own player sometimes leaves session, causes session to be unjoinable
body:
I've had this happen a few times, where the host player "Leaves" the server, even though its the one hosting it.

Could there be sanity/join checks, where it will try to rejoin its own game if it sees it left? Or stop the server if this happens.
author: ShadowJonathan

comments.body: This happends because your computer disconnects from steam, because the lobby is p2p it just goes to the next player whos been in the server the longest. I'll look into having the server check if its still in the lobby / connected to steam!
The server will now throw a fatal when this happens, if you have a auto restart script it will now auto restart it!

title: General doubt no issue
body: Hey! I was trying few things on the code, do you think its posible to modify players position?
author: Toresp

comments.body: It looks like it would be, if you send a actor_update to the player you want to move with an actor_update that has the players actor ID
Seems to work fine, but when it teleports the player it resets back its position where it was instantly, maybe its because of how client sided its managed hm
Would it be possible to send a packet to the client that changes their position, or does the game need to be modded to support such info? Imagine a "!tp" command, that'd be useful.

title: Add custom server join message
body: Gives users the ability to set a custom join message in the server config, useful in cases where a unique message based on the server usecase would be useful (e.g. suggestion for using antilag mod on 50 player servers)
author: aaronfisher-code

title: doesnt seem to work on linux
body: doesnt work with the linux steam client on ubuntu 22
author: dyrkuwu

comments.body: This is a known issue with Facepunch.Steamworks (the steamworks API cove is using). I plan on changing it to steamworks.net when I get the time, but right now I am in the middle of finals so it may be a week before I can do so.
Should be fixed in the latest nightly, if not reopen the issue!

title: libsteam_api64: No such file or directory
body:
Getting an error after server setup when attempting to start:

Unable to load shared library 'steam_api64' or one of its dependencies. In order to help diagnose loading problems, consider setting the LD_DEBUG environment variable: libsteam_api64: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

sorry if I'm just dumb
author: JackOtsig

comments.body: You just have to rename libsteam_api.so to libsteam_api64.so. Thats on me, I'll update the build action to automatically do that!

Ah, that makes sense, now facing the same issue as the other guy, but if they fixed it, so can I.
Thank you so much <3 you're amazing
anytime <3

title: Add user ban option
body: In light of the recent "Grincher" events with this player forcibly joining servers, a direct ban method would be nice to have using either the in-game system, or some custom solution if possible (as currently it seems he can join servers even when banned)
author: aaronfisher-code

comments.body: Need this ASAP... Just came here looking for the same thing. Having a dedicated server is now useless because he just joins after a few minutes of running it. We need a way to block steam IDs from connecting or something.

Added player bans #10 
v1.1.1 has everything added

Still having him join even when banned alongside a few others who seem to have discovered a way to  obfuscate their connection somehow to circumvent bans. Would there be a way to close these connections and sanitize their presence from the server?

title: Rain is extremely rare
body: that or it doesn't work at all
author: BeeFox-sys

comments.body: it does happen, however i do agree it does seem quite rare compared to normal. currently working around it on my server with the chat commands plugin. but thats not ideal. no idea if its just really bad RNG or server side tho.
In the latest release build there was an if statement in the wrong place making rain never spawn, it's fixed in the latest nightly but i will add a rain chance modifier to the config next update!
Issue fixed with 1.0.2! :D

title: Nightly-34: Only one player is able to load in
body:
it seems like something with nightly 34 is causing only the first person to connect to be able to load in. the other players are just stuck loading forever.

Stable 1.0.1 does not seem to have this issue.

Using the windows server currently.
author: Dentora

comments.body: I got two players connected no problem. Are there any errors in the server console?

there wasnt seemingly any errors, but do you think its possible the p2p is going thru my tailscale connection i got between my server and my PC? might be why i can connect but then others cant after i join. but its just a theory. ill try and see later tonight if turning that off solves it.
Might be it, trying the latest nightly I have gotten to ~20 players and all seemed fine

yeah i think it was possibly tailscale messing with the connection, sorry for the worry. :P

seems turning it off before connecting on my pc keeps it from happening.
thank you!!!!
